page.title: 01REVIEW OF THE FEN EDGE
page.content: The area covered by our survey is entirely rural, although the area is dissected by the A11(T) and the A45(T) roads which join together in the north (the effect of these roads on people's lives and the landscape, however, has been minimal). There is no industrial development and no amenities and in 1985 there are only twelve inhabited houses. The entire area, excepting the roads, is covered by two types of farming:- arable and stud. Until the late eighteenth century, it was an area of open downlands and formed part of Newmarket Heath.
